context: The formal language used in scientific research differs greatly from the natural language used in daily life. The naked eye has a wide field of view and can grasp the information of things as a whole: a microscope can help people see the details and subtleties of things, even though the scope of view is small. The development of science has greatly improved the daily lives of ordinary people, but people have not realized the importance of formal language, which is the foundation of scientific expression.

The decrease in wind speed means that the atmospheric diffusion capacity is weakened, leading to an extension of the retention time of atmospheric pollutants, which can easily lead to haze weather and heat island effects. For this reason, some experts have proposed the idea of establishing "urban air ducts", which means creating several unobstructed ventilation corridors in the city, allowing wind to enter and exit more freely, and promoting the renewal and circulation of urban air.
question: Which of the following, if true, would most support the idea of establishing an "urban air duct" mentioned above? ()
answers: The "street crossing wind" formed by urban air ducts has little impact on the safety of buildings.
The wind comes from all directions, and the idea of "urban air ducts" is too subjective and arbitrary.
Having air ducts but no air will make urban air ducts useless decorations.
Urban air ducts are not only beneficial for "haze removal", but also for heat dissipation.

context: In 2014, in preparation for the APEC Conference, Beijing, Tianjin, Hebei and other places implemented the "APEC Governance Model" and adopted the strictest emission reduction measures in history. If smog occurs frequently in Beijing during the APEC meeting, it will affect the image of our country.

context: According to existing laws of physics, the speed of motion of any substance cannot exceed the speed of light, but recent astronomical observations have challenged this law. The distant galaxy IC310 has an active black hole, and the material falling into the black hole generates gamma ray shock waves. Some astronomers have found that the speed of this gamma ray exceeds the speed of light because it only uses 4. It takes 8 minutes to cross the boundary of the black hole, while light takes 25 minutes to complete this distance. As a result, these astronomers proposed that the law of constant speed of light needs to be modified.
question: Which of the following, if true, would most question the conclusion made by the aforementioned astronomers? ()
answers: The law of constant speed of light has undergone multiple practical tests, and there have been no counter examples.
There may be deviations in astronomical observation data, as the IC310 galaxy is far from Earth.
Either the astronomer's observation is incorrect, or someone has tampered with the astronomical observation data.
Either the law of constant speed of light is outdated, or astronomers have made incorrect observations.

context: A company office provides self-service paid drinks in the tea room. After the staff finishes picking up the drinks, they put their money into a designated cash box. The four tables are numbered 1, 2, 3, and 4 from left to right, and each pair of players needs to play four games. The competition rules are: players get 2 points for each game they win, 1 point for each game they win, and 0 point for each game they lose. At the end of the first three games, the total points of the four pairs of players are 6:0, 5:1, 4:2, and 3:3, respectively, in order of difference in points. Known: (1) Zhang Fang plays chess with Lv Wei, Yang Hong competes at table 4, and Wang Yu's competition table is on the right side of Li Long's competition table; (2) At least one game in Table 1 is a draw, and the total points of both sides in Table 4 are not 4-2; (3) Zhao Hu did not lead his opponent in total points in the first three innings, and they also did not make a draw; (4) Li Long has lost three consecutive games, and Fan Yong leads his opponent in total points in the first three games.
question: If one of the following contestants has drawn a draw with their opponent in the first three games, who is he or she?
answers: Shilin.
Yang Hong.
Zhang Fang.
Fan Yong.

context: Under the New Normal, profound changes have taken place in consumer demand. Only high-quality and high priced products can meet demand.

context: According to the carbon-14 test, the creation of rock paintings in Kapimala can be traced back to 30000 years ago. So today we can see in these rock paintings: a mother lifting her child to play, a family looking up and trying to touch the starry sky above their heads... Animals are another protagonist in the rock paintings, such as giant armadillos, red deer, crabs, etc. In many scenes, people hold spears and chase prey ahead. It can be inferred that humans were already at the top of the food chain at this time.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above inference?
answers: The reverence for the starry sky is one of the driving forces behind human detachment from animals and the emergence of religion.
With rock paintings, humans can preserve their life experiences for future generations to learn, greatly improving their survival ability.
30000 years ago, humans needed to avoid being hunted by large carnivores such as tigers and leopards.
The animals appearing in rock paintings were generally the objects of human hunting at that time.

context: People have been arguing about which cat or dog is smarter. context: In recent years, the use of mobile phones and computers has led to increasingly blurred boundaries between work and life, and people's average sleep time has been decreasing. context: Tourism is a unique cultural experience. Tourists can travel in groups or freely. Although freelance tourists have avoided the collective constraints of group tours, they have also abandoned the full process of manual guided tours. However, in recent years, their cultural demand for understanding tourist attractions has not decreased. To meet this market demand, multiple intelligent tour guide apps based on mobile platforms have been developed. They can locate the user's location and automatically provide functions such as scenic spot explanations and sightseeing Q&A. Experts have pointed out that in the future, intelligent tour guides will inevitably replace manual tour guides, and the traditional tour guide profession is about to disappear.
question: Which of the following, if true, would most question the expert's assertion mentioned above?
answers: The intelligent tour guide app, which is only used during travel, remains to be solved in terms of how to maintain user stickiness and how to achieve commercial value in the future.

The manual tour guides provided in domestic scenic spots require fees, and most of the tour guides' explanations are standardized and memorized beforehand. However, even if artificial tour guides have no unique features, it will take some time for them to exit the market.

At present, the user base of the well-developed intelligent tour guide app is around one million, which is only a small proportion of the total number of tourists in China. The market has not yet cultivated the general consumption habits of users.

A good artificial tour guide can provide different types of explanations according to the needs of tourists, not only focusing on scenic spots, but also expressing opinions. It has strong personalization, which is difficult for intelligent tour guides to achieve.

context: Nowadays, children's homework is not just their own business. Most parents of primary and secondary school students face the task of accompanying their children to do homework, including dictating, checking homework, signing, and so on. According to a survey of more than 3000 parents, 84% of parents accompany their children to do homework every day, while 67% of surveyed parents feel annoyed because they accompany their children to do homework. Experts have pointed out that accompanying children with homework by parents is equivalent to acting as an assistant to school teachers, making the family an extension of the classroom and having a negative impact on children's growth.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the expert's assertion?
answers: Parents should not focus on homework assigned by teachers when tutoring their children, but should focus on stimulating their interest in learning, cultivating good learning habits, and making them feel novel and happy in their growth.

Parents usually have their own job responsibilities. Some have to work overtime at night, while others need to research and manage household chores even when they come home at night. It is generally difficult for them to have the energy to conscientiously complete the "homework" assigned by school teachers.

Parents are the best teachers, and tutoring children to acquire various knowledge is inherent in family education. For children in middle and lower grades, parental companionship during the learning process is particularly important.

Parents accompanying their children to do homework can lead to a lack of independence and initiative in their studies, and they are constantly under the dual pressure of both teachers and parents, making it difficult to develop interest in learning and develop an independent personality.

context: The Tianshan Mountains in China are a model of vertical zonality. Desert, mountain grassland, mountain meadow grassland, alpine meadow, forest zone, mountain meadow, ice and snow zone.

question: Which of the following is most appropriate as a follow-up to the above?

Through monsoons and ocean currents, the heat from the Earth's equator spreads towards both poles.
During a solar eclipse, due to the obstruction of the moon, the amount of sunlight shining on Earth is significantly reduced.
The core of the Earth has been in a molten state due to the accumulation of thermal energy.

context: If the price of flour continues to rise, the cost of bread at Jiashi Bakery will significantly increase. context: Zhang, Wang, Li, and Zhao entered the semi-finals of table tennis. context: Recent studies have shown that long-term close contact with parrots increases the risk of lung cancer. context: A sociologist believes that every enterprise strives to reduce production costs. In order to increase the profits of the enterprise, but not all efforts to reduce production costs are beneficial to the enterprise. If some enterprises reduce the purchase of social insurance for employees, they can temporarily reduce production costs. However, in the long run, the gains and losses are not worth the losses, which will harm the interests of employees, reduce their sense of belonging, and affect the production efficiency of the enterprise.
question: Which of the following best represents the conclusion stated by the sociologist mentioned above?
answers: If a measure can increase a company's profits but cannot improve employee welfare, it is not worth advocating.
Some measures taken by enterprises to reduce costs may not always be beneficial for their development.
Only when the interests of employees and entrepreneurs are aligned, can the measures taken by the enterprise be beneficial for its development.
The efforts of enterprises to reduce production costs need to be comprehensively considered from the perspective of the overall interests of the enterprise.

context: Mr. X has always been hailed as a literary master in the 19th century Western world, but the benefits he gained from his predecessors were overlooked by critics. context: A study found that girls who use drugs (such as ecstasy) are 2-3 times more likely to suffer from depression than girls who do not engage in such behavior; Boys who drink excessively are five times more likely to suffer from depression than boys who do not drink. context: Even in ancient times, farms that produced grains on a large scale could only survive through large-scale agricultural markets, which meant the existence of cities with a considerable population. Because in Chinese history, there was only a small-scale peasant economy with one household, and there had never been a large-scale agricultural model such as farms. Therefore, the ancient Chinese cities discovered by archaeology are likely not densely populated cities, but only temporary gathering places for people to hold certain ceremonies.
question: Which of the following most appropriately points out the loopholes in the above argument?
answers: This conclusion is only a repetition of a certain conclusion in its premise.
The definition of a key concept in the argument is inconsistent.
In the same argument, different interpretations were given to an ambiguous conclusion.
The non-existence of a certain situation as a necessary condition to prove that such a situation also does not exist.

context: The width of the motorcycle lane on the main road in a certain city is 2 meters, and many motorcycle riders often rush to drive on the lane, seriously disrupting traffic order and causing frequent traffic accidents. context: A large area of forest diseases and pests has occurred in a certain mountainous area. context: In the past, people rarely received spam on their computers. context: The black vein golden butterfly larva first breaks the veins of the poisonous milkweed plant, causing the venom to flow out before feeding on the entire leaf. In general, after the veins of milkweed plants are broken, the venom inside them is basically completely drained, and even if there is a very small amount of residue, it does not pose a threat to the larvae. The black vein golden butterfly larvae use poisonous milkweed plants as their food source in this way until they mature.
question: Which of the following is most likely the assumption made earlier?
answers: Larvae have various ways to deal with the venom of toxic plants, therefore, toxic plants are a food source for various larvae.
Except for the black vein golden butterfly larvae, milkweed plants are not suitable for consumption by other larvae.
Except for milkweed plants, other toxic plants have evolved to the extent that they can prevent the black vein butterfly larvae from damaging their leaf veins.
The leaf veins of milkweed plants have not evolved to the extent that black vein golden butterfly larvae cannot break.

context: Zhaojia Village has much less farmland than Majia Village, but its unit production cost has been significantly lower in recent years than Majia Village. context: Recently, domestic archaeologists have discovered ancient sites from the Spring and Autumn period in a remote area in the north. context: In 1979, an elephant was discovered in the Moses region of Africa entering a cave on Mount Laideng while foraging. Soon, other elephants also began to enter the cave, and in the following years, entering the cave became a routine activity for the entire elephant herd. Before 1979, no elephants were found entering the cave in the Moses area, and there were no signs of elephants inside the cave. By 2006, the entire elephant herd had spent most of its winter in or near the cave. It can be seen that elephants are able to accept and impart new behaviors, which are not determined by genetic factors.
question: Which of the following is the assumption of the above discussion?
answers: Genetic mutations in elephants can occur over a relatively short time span, such as several decades.
The new behaviors that have emerged in elephant herds over the past few decades are not predetermined by genetic factors.
The new behavior patterns of elephants are prone to becoming fixed patterns, usually lasting for several generations.
The herd behavior of elephants is not influenced by genetics, but rather the result of mutual imitation among individuals within the herd.

context: When debating the issue of smoking, the legitimate side believes that smoking is beneficial for weight loss, as people often gain weight after quitting smoking compared to before. context: A: People can obtain any desired information and materials from the internet. context: The husband and wife discuss which primary school the child should attend. context: A certain online company conducted a survey on the population who logged into the "Psychologist's Window" website to seek psychological help through a questionnaire. context: Market investigators have found that when choosing clothing in winter, some people would rather endure the cold than choose fashionable but not warm clothing. Some parents are influenced by their children when purchasing ice skates for them in the mall, and they choose trendy and beautiful ice skates, even if other types of ice skates are safer and more reliable.

context: Xiao Chen often receives tickets from the traffic management bureau for speeding his car. answers: Inferring a causal relationship solely based on the connection between phenomena.
Draw a general conclusion based on an overly narrow example.

context: The newly extruded milk contains antibacterial active ingredients such as lysozyme. context: A study focused on 288 high school third year science students and divided them into two groups for testing. context: A certain lottery sales station has been selling an anonymous and non loss "scratch watch" lottery in the past six months. answers: Zhang Sanzhen believes that he won 8000 yuan.

context: There are millions of genes in nature, which ones are the most common and abundant? A research organization found the answer after successfully decoding a large number of genomes, that is, transposon, which is called "selfish DNA". Biology textbooks generally believe that the enzyme that can fix carbon dioxide in photosynthesis is the most abundant enzyme on Earth, and some scholars have speculated that the genes that can encode this enzyme should also be the most abundant. However, research has found that transposons, known as "junk DNA," actually dominate the world of known genes.

answers: The basic function of transposons is to spread themselves everywhere.

context: A research paper published in a well-known foreign academic journal reveals that when a person is angry, their body produces a series of reactions, which accelerate their heart rate, cause endocrine disorders, increase blood pressure, disrupt the digestive system, and in severe cases, may cause vomiting or even fainting. context: The members of a mountaineering tourism group helped each other and established a deep friendship. Li Jia, who joined later, has received multiple rescues from other members, but she has not yet rescued anyone. Everyone who has helped Li Jia has been rescued by Wang Yue, Zhao Xin has rescued all members of the group, and the people who have been rescued by Wang Yue have also been rescued by Chen Fan.
question: Based on the above statement, which of the following conclusions can be drawn?
answers: Chen Fan helped Zhao Xin.
Wang Yue has helped Li Jia.
Wang Yue helped Chen Fan.
Chen Fan helped Li Jia.

context: A newspaper group in a certain city encountered difficulties in operation and sought assistance from a consulting company. The consulting company dispatched Dr. Zhang to investigate the distribution period of the target newspaper. There were morning newspapers, daily newspapers in the morning, and evening newspapers in the afternoon, all of which were not prepared for the night. Dr. Zhang suggested that they create a "City Evening News" to occupy this market.
question: Which of the following, if true, can appropriately point out the problems in Dr. Zhang's analysis?
answers: The distribution period of newspapers and the reading time of readers may be different.
The lights in bars or cinemas are dim and unable to read newspapers.
Many people have the habit of reading books before bedtime, while there are relatively few who read newspapers.
People are usually accustomed to watching TV programs at night and rarely read newspapers.

context: A researcher fed bee larvae with fresh royal jelly and royal jelly that had been stored for 30 days, and the results showed that larvae fed with fresh royal jelly grew into queens. Further research has found that a protein called "royalactin" in fresh royal jelly can promote the secretion of growth hormone, causing larvae to exhibit queen like characteristics such as enlarged body size and developed ovaries. Researchers fed fruit flies with this protein, which also showed growth in body length, egg laying number, and lifespan, indicating that the impact of this protein on biological characteristics is cross species.
question: Which of the following, if true, can support the findings of the researchers mentioned above?
answers: The worker bees and queen bees in the bee colony are all female and genetically identical, with no difference in their larvae.
The genetic differences between bees and fruit flies are not significant, as they share many common biological characteristics.
'Royalactin' can only be stored for a short period of time and will decompose into other substances over time.
The food for bee larvae that can grow into queen bees is royal jelly, while the food for other larvae is only pollen and honey.

context: Some volunteers participated in experiments to evaluate the sweetness of beverages, and the results showed that those who frequently drank sugary beverages and were overweight rated the sweetness of the same beverage at a lower level than those of normal individuals. This indicates that their taste buds' sensitivity to sweetness has decreased. The experimental results also showed that those who were overweight subconsciously tended to choose sweeter foods. This indicates that eating too much sugar may create a vicious cycle, where frequent consumption of sugar can lead to a decrease in the sensitivity of the taste buds to sweetness, a decrease in satisfaction brought about by eating the same amount of sugar, and subconsciously demand more sugar. As a result, consuming too much sugar can lead to obesity.
question: Which of the following can support the above argument?
answers: There are standards for evaluating the sweetness of beverages.
Volunteers are able to accurately evaluate the sweetness of beverages.
People who enjoy eating sweets often cannot resist the temptation of sweetness.
Satisfaction is governed by the subconscious.

context: In 2010, the specific situation of schools in a certain country providing training for teachers was as follows: 38% of public schools had 1% to 25% of teachers participating, 18% of public schools had 26% to 50% of teachers participating, 13% of public schools had 51% to 75% of teachers participating, and 30% of public schools had 76% or even more teachers participating in such training. In contrast, 37% of rural schools have 1% to 25% of teachers participating, 20% of rural schools have 26% to 50% of teachers participating, 12% of rural schools have 51% to 75% of teachers participating, and 29% of rural schools have 76% or even more teachers participating. This indicates that the probability of rural school teachers receiving training is comparable to that of urban, suburban, and urban school teachers in the country.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best refute the above argument?
answers: The content of teacher training is diverse and varied.
The conditions and effects of teacher training vary greatly.
Some teachers work both in public schools and part-time in rural schools.
There are also many public schools in rural areas, and many rural schools in the suburbs.

context: The researchers used the X-ray technology of the European synchrotron radiation Accelerator to scan the fossil of Eupoda hidden in an ancient rock 95 million years ago. It was found that this type of snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of its origin. The research report indicates that this snake has a body length of 50 centimeters and only one foot on the surface, approximately 2 centimeters long. X-ray scanning revealed the other foot of this true legged snake. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is because it has undergone alienation in the rock, with only 4 bones in the ankle and no toes, indicating that the foot of the true legged snake had shown a trend of degeneration at that time.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the views of the aforementioned scholars?
answers: The era of this true legged snake coincides with the evolution of snakes from footless animals to footed lizards.
The era of this true legged snake coincides with the evolution of snakes from pods to invertebrates.
The era of this true legged snake coincides with the decline of snakes from footless animals to footed lizards.
The era of this true legged snake coincides with the decline of snakes from pods to invertebrates.

context: Between two large "A" shaped tombs and a circular rammed earth foundation, five horse pits and one rectangular chariot and horse pit were found. Six horses were buried in each of the two horse pits. The skeleton of a pit is neatly arranged in two rows, north and south, with 2 horses in the front row and 4 horses in the back row, arranged in order from west to east; The arrangement of the horse skeleton in another pit is quite unique, with six horses placed in pairs or facing each other, with different heads facing each other. A relatively special phenomenon is the placement of an ox horn in the middle of the horse pit, which suggests that the horse pit may be related to ritual activities.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above speculation?
answers: Ox horns were important objects during ancient sacrificial ceremonies.
The horses that were sacrificed during the sacrificial ceremony must have the same basic shape and head orientation.
Six horses were a basic form of worship for ancient princes.
Bull horns are only placed in the horse pit during sacrificial ceremonies.

context: Enceladus is one of the three stars in the solar system that have been observed to exist in geological eruptions so far, and it is also one of the most important research objects in astrobiology. German scientists have found that the particles emitted by Enceladus contain sodium salts using analytical instruments on the Cassini Saturn probe. Based on this, it can be inferred that there is liquid water on Enceladus, and there may even be an "underground sea".
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above speculation?
answers: Only with the existence of "underground seas" can there be eruptive activity at the site.
Liquid water cannot exist alone on Enceladus, it can only exist in the form of an 'underground sea'.
Without geological eruptions on Enceladus, it is impossible to discover sodium salts.
Only in the presence of liquid water can sodium salt particles be present.

context: Chinese surnames have a very significant characteristic, which is that they share the same Han surname but may have significant differences in blood relationship. On the whole, taking Mount Wuyi the Nanling Mountain as the boundary, the blood relationship of Chinese surnames is obviously divided into two branches, the north and the south. The blood relationship differences between the Han ethnic groups in the two regions are quite significant, even greater than the differences between the Han ethnic groups in the north and south and the local ethnic minorities. This indicates that with the expansion of the population, the Han ethnic group continued to move southward and crossed the Yangtze River to enter Huguang over 2000 years ago, ultimately crossing the strait to reach Hainan Island. During this process, the Han people who migrated south continuously merged with various ethnic groups that spoke Dong Tai, South Asia, and Miao languages, thereby diluting the blood relationship characteristics of the Han people in the north.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best refute the above argument?
answers: The ethnic minorities in the south may be the northern ethnic groups who migrated southward even more recently.
The feudal emperors once granted some people from minority ethnic groups the surname of the emperor.
The northern and southern branches of the same surname may not come from the same ancestor.
In history, there have also been cases of ethnic minorities moving northward.

context: British scientists reported in an article published in the journal Nature on November 11, 2010 that they have discovered a bacterial fossil in rocks in Scotland that may have lived about 1.2 billion years ago. This indicates that the significant event of increasing oxygen concentration on Earth to the level required for human evolution occurred 1.2 billion years ago, 400 million years earlier than scientists previously thought. The new research is expected to help scientists re understand the timeline of the Earth's atmosphere and the evolution of life that relies on it for survival.
question: Which of the following is assumed by scientists based on the above findings?
answers: Previously, it was believed that human evolution occurred approximately 800 million years ago.
This type of bacteria began using oxygen in chemical reactions about 1.2 billion years ago to obtain energy for survival.
The increase in oxygen concentration marks the transformation of the dominant organisms on Earth from simple organic matter to complex multicellular organic matter.
Only when the oxygen concentration in the atmosphere increases to a critical point can certain bacteria survive.

context: At the end of 2009, the survey results of the Ministry of Health in China showed that only 6% of the population had overall health qualities. 48% of them have chronic disease prevention literacy, accounting for only 4%. 66%. This indicates that the national awareness of diseases is still very scarce. Only with a fundamental improvement in the quality of the people, can the fallacies of Li Yi and Zhang Wu not be blindly followed by so many people.
question: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the above statements?
answers: Lack of understanding of diseases is one of the manifestations of the fundamental improvement of national quality.
If the national quality cannot be fundamentally improved, many people will blindly follow the fallacy of Li Yi and others.
The lack of basic medical knowledge among the people is the fundamental reason for the frequent success of quack doctors.
Only by raising awareness of diseases among citizens can their health be guaranteed.

context: Archaeologists from the University of Newcastle and the University of Manchester in the UK have discovered a remains of a human house with a history of over 10000 years in Staca, North Yorkshire. The dating results show that it is about 3 meters high. The 5-meter wooden circular hut existed in 8500 BC, at least 500 years prior to the oldest house discovered in England. Archaeologists also discovered a wooden platform and a well preserved trunk of a large tree nearby. In addition, they also discovered processed deer antler jewelry, indicating that people at that time had already engaged in some ceremonial activities.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above viewpoint?
answers: A wooden platform is the workplace where humans build small wooden houses.
At that time, the British already had relatively stable residences, rather than the previously thought homeless hunters.
Humans are social animals, and there are more wooden houses waiting to be excavated nearby.
Only ceremonial activities can produce processed antler jewelry.

context: Researchers at Ohio State University in the United States conducted research on over 1. 30000 middle school students from grades 7 to 12 were surveyed. In the survey, researchers asked these students to list 5 male and female friends each, and then counted the total number of votes received by these nominated friends. The person who received 5 votes was selected for survey statistics. Research has found that among those who receive five votes, the proportion of only children is consistent with their proportion in this age group, indicating that there is no significant difference in social skills between them and non only children, and this result is not affected by parents' age, race, or economic status.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above research findings?
answers: Among those who did not receive votes, the proportion of only children was higher than their proportion in this survey.
The proportion of only children who received votes is similar to their proportion in this survey.
Among those who received 1 vote, the proportion of only children was much higher than their proportion in this survey.
Among the top 500 votes, the proportion of only children is comparable to their proportion in this survey.

context: On the morning of November 8, the Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense released for the first time the partial image of the Moon Hongwan area, the pre selected landing area of Chang'e 3, transmitted from Chang'e 2 satellite. It is a black and white photo, with an imaging time of 18:00 on October 28th, and the satellite is approximately 18 meters away from the lunar surface. Captured from a location of 7 kilometers. The return of the photographic images marks that the six engineering goals set by the Chang'e 2 mission have been achieved, and that the "Chang'e 2" project has been a complete success. The main task of the launch of Chang'e 2 is to take high-resolution pictures of the moon's Hongwan area, so as to prepare for the launch of Chang'e 3 satellite and its landing in the future. It is reported that the resolution of the CCD camera carried by Chang'e 2 is much higher than that carried by Chang'e-1. The resolution of Chang'e 2 is better than 10 meters when it runs in a 100 km circular orbit, entering 100 km × The resolution of the 15 km elliptical orbit is up to 1 m, which has exceeded the original preset resolution of 1. A 5-meter indicator. It is understood that there will also be CCD cameras on the Chang'e 3 lander in the future. At that time, it will not only take photos, but also automatically avoid the places that are not suitable for landing during the soft landing process of the lander according to the pictures. "On the fly decision" will select a flat surface suitable for landing for the lander.
question: Which of the following statements best fits the viewpoint of the question stem
answers: It will take about 10 days for Chang'e 2 to transmit local images of the moon's rainbow bay area to the Earth.
The only mission of Chang'e 2 is to take high-resolution pictures of the moon's Hongwan area.
Chang'e 2 captured local images of the Hongwan area of the moon when it was in a 100 km circular orbit.
Chang'e 2 captured local images of the Hongwan area of the moon while orbiting the moon in an elliptical orbit.

Butterfly wings are generally brightly colored, with various patterns on the wings and body, and a pile of rod-shaped or hammered antennae on the head. The largest butterfly's wings can reach 24 centimeters, while the smallest one is only 1. 6 centimeters.

context: Researchers report that a survey involving over 10000 elderly people over the age of 70 showed that those who slept more than 9 hours or less per day had lower average cognitive levels than those who slept around 7 hours per day. answers: There is no professional medical device yet that can detect a person's sleep time
